titleStmt.title: The state of the case, briefly but impartially given betwixt the people called Quakers, Pensilvania, &c. in America, who remain in unity, and George Keith, with some few seduced by him into a separation from them as also a just vindication of my self from the reproaches and abuses of those backsliders / by Samuel Jennings.
titleStmt.author: Jennings, Samuel, d. 1708.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by T. Sowle ...,

notesStmt.note: Includes minutes of a session of the justices of Philadelphia county court, March 25, 1692, Peter Boss's paper attacking Samuel Jennings, and a signed statement by a group of Friends defending the author.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
